series.title: Adolescence
series.synopsis: A family's world is turned upside down when 13-year-old Jamie Miller is arrested for the murder of a classmate. As detectives search for answers, parents, police and a psychologist confront every parent's worst nightmare — in real time.

episodes.title: Episode 1
episodes.description: Police raid the Miller home; Jamie is arrested and insists on his innocence.

episodes.title: Episode 2
episodes.description: Detectives comb the school for the murder weapon; Bascombe's son uncovers a lead.

episodes.title: Episode 3
episodes.description: Jamie's first therapy session cracks open the truth about Katie.

episodes.title: Episode 4
episodes.description: On Eddie's birthday the family unravels as new evidence surfaces.

cast.description: 13-year-old accused of murder; quiet and volatile.
Jamie's father, desperately protective, co-creator of the show.
Jamie's mother, fighting to hold the family together.

creators.name: Stephen Graham
creators.description: Stephen Graham not only stars as Eddie Miller but also co-created and executive produced the series, bringing his vision to life.

creators.name: Jack Thorne
creators.description: Acclaimed writer Jack Thorne collaborated with Stephen Graham to create this powerful limited series.

creators.name: Philip Barantini
creators.description: Known for his work on Boiling Point, Philip Barantini directed all four episodes of Adolescence, bringing a consistent vision to the limited series.

executiveProducers: Philip Barantini (It's All Made Up Prods)
Brad Pitt, Jeremy Kleiner, Dede Gardner, Nina Wolarsky (Plan B Ent.)

rottenTomatoes.quote: Stylistically bold and beautifully acted… a searing viewing experience that scars.

criticReviews.content: CEO Ted Sarandos calls it 'artistically exceptional' and warns U.S. viewers to enable subtitles because of thick regional accents.
criticReviews.author: Cultural Reporter

criticReviews.content: 114 million views in less than 1 month; early talks for Season 2 underway. The show's intense examination of teen psychology has clearly resonated with viewers worldwide.
criticReviews.author: Entertainment Analyst

criticReviews.content: Achieved a rare 100% RT score on opening weekend; hailed as 'the best British thriller since Baby Reindeer.' Graham's performance as a father in crisis is nothing short of extraordinary.
criticReviews.author: TV Critic

criticReviews.content: A masterclass in tension and character development. Owen Cooper's portrayal of Jamie Miller will be remembered as one of the most nuanced teen performances in recent memory.
criticReviews.author: Television Editor

criticReviews.content: Barantini's direction creates a claustrophobic atmosphere that perfectly complements the narrative. Each frame is meticulously crafted to enhance the emotional impact.
criticReviews.author: Senior Critic

stats.netflixRanking: #1 Position on Netflix Global Top 10 for 4 consecutive weeks
